newsitem.title: BAHRAIN: Okasan bank to be liquidated.
newsitem.headline: Okasan bank to be liquidated.

text.p: Okasan International E.C., a Bahrain-based investment bank, said on Monday it was to be liquidated.
"Shareholders of Okasan International have decided at an extraordinary meeting to voluntarily liquidate the company from July 1," a bank official told Reuters.
"The secondary market has not been good in the past seven years, prompting the closure of the bank," the official said.
Accountants and auditors Ernst & Young have been appointed as liquidator.
Bank officials said in May the bank would officially be closed down on June 30.
Okasan is 51 percent owned by Okasan Securities of Japan. Financial institutions in Bahrain and Kuwait and Marubeni International Finance Plc held the remaining stake.
